characters: SEE YOU ON SATURDAY, I MISS YOU..."
QUALITY TIME WITH THE CONSTRUCTION CREW. HOPE YOU'RE HAVI
PLEASE PICK ONE OUT AND LET ME KNOW. I'M HAVING LOTS OF
YOU DIDN'T TELL ME WHICH SHELVES YOU WANT IN YOUR STUDY.
DO YOU HAVE NO IDEA WHERE YOUR CAREER IS GOING
IT'S A NOTE AND CUTE DRAWING FROM JOHN -
BURGUNDY, BUT WHATEVER YOU WANT. LOVE, L"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of a plane landing over black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of a GIRL in pink underwear, she leans at a big  window, looking out over Tokyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melodramatic music swells over the Girl's butt in pink sh underwear as she lies on the bed. TITLE CARDS OVER IMAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV from a car window - the colors and lights of Tokyo ne at night blur by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backseat of a Presidential limousine, BOB (late- forties), tired and depressed, leans against a little doi staring out the window. P.O.V. from car window- We see buildings covered in brigh signs, a billboard of Brad Pitt selling jeans, another of Bob in black & white,looking distinguished with a bot whiskey in a Suntory ad... more signs, a huge TV with per Japanese pop stars singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's black Presidential (looks like a 60's diplomat's ca pulls up at the entrance of the Park Hyatt, a modern sky  rise. The automatic doors open on the car, as Bob gets out.   E BELLHOPS with white gloves approach at the sight of the c welcoming Bob and helping him with his bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob stands in the back of a crowded elevator surrounded b Japanese businessmen below his shoulders. The elevator stops at the 50th floor and the doors open o the massive, streamline lobby of the Park Hyatt. Bob follows the JAPANESE BUSINESSMEN out into the marble glass lobby that frames the view of Tokyo. The CONCIERGE and several eager HOTEL MANAGERS greet Bob. just wants to sleep, but more STAFF continue to greet him ask him about his fright. They lead him to reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the reception area four JAPANESE BUSINESSMEN and two W quickly sit up from their seats on sight of Bob, and exte handshakes and gifts. They bow and introduce themselves f the commercial company, extend name cards and welcome him enthusiastically. More staff welcomes him and offer their service during hi stay. One of them presents a fax that has come for him.

dialogues.speaker: HAVE A GOOD TRIP, L"
dialogues.text: He doesn't know what to do with it, and stuffs it in his  pocket. The commercial people tell him when they'll be picking hi up, and ask if he needs anything else. Some JAPANESE ROCK STARS with shag haircuts and skinny le pants pass by. Each commercial person has to shake Bob's  hand before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sits on the end of the bed in a too small hotel kimon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sits at the bar. A few minutes pass as he sits in sil looking around, drinking a scotch.  Chet Baker sings "The Thrill is Gone" over the stereo. We see Bob's POV of tables of people talking. JAPANESE WO SMOKING, AMERICAN BUSINESSMEN tying one on, talking about software sales. A WAITER carefully setting down a coaster and pouring a beer very, very slowly. It's all very forei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The automatic hotel curtains open, pouring light into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gets in the shower overlooking the view of Tokyo. The shower head is at his elbows, he raises it as high as it  goes, and leans down to have a shower. This hotel was not designed with him in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiskey commercial shoot. The set is full of activity as the JAPANESE CREW work. Bo in a shawl collared tuxedo sits at a European style bar s with a cut crystal glass of whiskey. A JAPANESE GIRL quic powders his face as they adjust lights and the DIRECTOR a crew speak in hurried Japanese. The Director (with blue contact lenses) says a few long  sentences in Japanese. TRANSLATOR, a middle-aged woman in a coordinated outfit,  translates but it is only a short sentence now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants you to turn, look in camera  and say the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob wonders what she's leaving out, or if that's the way works from Japanese to English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all he said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, turn to camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob thinks let's just get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn left or right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Translator blots her face with a tissue, and asks the director in a Japanese sentence 5 times as long. The Dire answers her in a long excited phrase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right side. And with intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that everything? It seemed like  he was saying a lot more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The excited Director says more in Japanese. Translator no in understanding. Bob doesn't really know what's going on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an old friend, and into the  camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob)) Suntory Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get ready, and roll camera: Bob turns and looks suavely to the camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For relaxing times, make it Suntory  Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Director yells something about ten sentences long. Th translator nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you do it slower, and with  more intensity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Translator answers for him in four sentences. ON THE MONITOR - we see the next take: the moody lighting shines on Bob, the camera gets closer as he stares into c and gives them the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For relaxing times, make it Suntory  Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shinjuku High rises sparkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall glass walls show the neon and high-rises of the city A sad and romantic Bill Evans song plays. Bob sits alone  with a scotch at the bar. Some drunk AMERICAN BUSINESSMEN, with their ties thrown o their shoulders recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey- you're Bob Harris- you're  awesome, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I love Sunset  Odds! BOB Oh,  Ok, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that car chase-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob  nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob comes back to his room. The maids have left everythin perfect, his beige bed is turned down, and the TV has bee left on to a channel playing a montage of flower close-up in nature while sad violin music plays. It's supposed to relaxing, but it's just sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob lies in bed. He flips through TV channels from the re control.  He passes a Japanese game show, to an 80s Canno Ball run-type movie with him in it dubbed into Japanese. turns it off as he hears a knock at the door. He goes to the door, and opens it part way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Raspy Japanese voice) Mr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kazuzo sent me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I enter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, then opens the door. A WOMAN in her forties in a short tight leather mini skir and stockings comes in. She is wearing '60s style make-up Bob sits on the bed not sure what to do as he watches her Bob's POV - We see her back to us as she puts a CD on the stereo - it begins to play: Serge Gainsberg and Brigitte  Bardot sing "Bonnie & Clyde".  The woman turns slyly and shimmies over to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she tries to  undress him) Mr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like massage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kazuzo send Premium Fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes him back onto the bed. He hesitates, but then  goes along with it passively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stockings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles with her stockings, trying to do as she says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - Lip  them... Don't touch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his hands back confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lip my stockings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs away, as he tries to understand her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lip them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws her leg up to him on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pantomimes ripping them. He finally understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you want me to rip them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls at her stockings trying to rip them, but they ju snap. She pretends to struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls his hands away. She grabs them and puts them bac on her, and keeps struggling dramatically. They wrestle a awkwardly, her pretending to try to get away, but not let him go. She rips her stockings and falls off the bed in f defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a confused Bob down on top of her. He doesn't k what she wants. She rips another stocking and pins him on the ground. He  tries to crawl away, she grabs his leg and trips him. He  grabs a nearby table leg as he falls, the lamp crashes to the floor, the room goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the harsh sunlight of the big windows Bob eats breakfa alone. Next to him is a table of TEXANS in cowboy hats. A another table a JAPANESE COUPLE in sunglasses chain smoke and drink coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gets into the ded elevator. He is stopped momentarily the Concierge who asks him if everything is fine for his  stay. In the elevator Bob's surrounded by JAPANESE BUSINESSPEOP and a FAMILY dressed for a wedding. Across, at the other side of the elevator he sees CHARLOT a pretty Ivy-league girl in her mid-twenties, and the onl other Westerner in the elevator. Her honey-colored hair s out in the crowd. She's looking at him like you do when someone new comes i the elevator, but the Japanese look straight ahead at the elevator doors. Charlotte and Bob look at each other across the Japanese  heads. She smiles, from one foreigner to another. The doo opens and she gets out with the crowd. Bob watches her le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is approached by a group of eight excited people from commercial company there waiting to take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they are on their  way) We just got a request from Tanabe  Mori-he is the Johnny Carson of Japan!  It is a big honor to be invited to  his show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob feigns enthusiasm briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stay until Friday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to see about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's back is to us as a MAKE-UP ARTIST is putting some f touches on him. The PHOTOGRAPHER is giving her enthusiast direction in Japanese. Bob talks on his cell phone, not p attention to the make-up artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get me on a flight Thursday  night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking into it Bob, but they  really want you to stay to do that  talk show Friday, apparently it's a  really big deal, he's the Johnny  Carson of Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people are paying you a lot,  do you think you could consider it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get me out of here as soon as  you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, you're scheduled to leave  Saturday, but we'll hold a seat  Thursday in case, but first class is  full, you're waitlisted for an  upgrade... there might be a seat on  Lufthansa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great. I'll talk to you later,  bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. The make-up artist dusts him with powder. The commercial people are crowding around. Bob's chair is swivelled around and we see him in his tuxedo, wearing to much make-up and some weird looking eyeliner. In front of a grey backdrop, moody lighting is being adju and Bob is handed a bottle of Suntory. small documentary crew moves in on Bob with a video camer the camera man is tilting the camera at his face in arty  dutch camera moves. The agency people crowd around. The photographer is excit and urges Bob to do dumb poses, he won't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you put hands close to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer demonstrates a dramatic pose with his ha at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urn, I don't think so. How bout I  just hold the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer starts shooting. Bob obviously hates the whole thing, what you do for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, still in his tuxedo and make-up from the shoot, sits alone having a drink. A JAZZ BAND FROM SAUSALITO performs The SINGER is a middle-aged woman with red wavy hair, dre in red, and takes her singing very seriously. She sings a slow version of "Parsley, Sage, Rosemary and Thyme". C.U. - a golden beer is poured very slowly. Bob drinks his scotch, hoping it will all go away. Across the bar, Charlotte sits with JOHN, her husband (he in his late twenties and sloppy in a fashionable way), an some FRIENDS - super stylish, weird Japanese fashion peop (all smoking). One of them, CHARLIE, in a shiny suit, kee taking pictures, and showing them magazine layouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. We're glad to be here,  we're Sausalito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte laughs and looks down, the Japanese audience cl very seriously... she and Bob catch eyes - about Sausalit and how weird it is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mirrored elevator doors close and Bob sees himself cl up in the elevator's mirrored walls - noticing the heavy  makeup and weird eyeliner from the shoot which he had  forgotten about. He looks at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lays close to her young husband, John. She look to see if he's awake, but he's sleeping soundly. She lean her chin on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grumbles something, opens one sleepy eye to look at he and grabs her under the covers. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her close, but she can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte sits on a ledge looking out at the big building The sun is starting to come up. Below she watches cars go places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob lies in bed awake. The clock says 4:20. The in-room fax machine is making noise as a fax rolls in Bob looks at the fax machine but doesn't get out of bed. The fax curls and falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FUN THERE. LOVE, L"
dialogues.text: Three pages of shelf diagrams follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is empty except for an old man vacuuming. Bob pas piles of little towels and bottles of water. He takes a w for his workout. He approaches an exercise machine and puts the water in t drink holder of the machine. He looks at the lit-up  instruction panel'99 it is all in Japanese. He pushes a button, and the machine starts beeping, then soothing woman's voice recites instructions in Japanese. He gets on it, and sinks. He tries to make the arms and f peddles coordinate. He pushes a button and it starts movi too fast. In an upward rotation he tries to reach the con panel, but is not fast enough. The soothing woman's voice continues instruction.(she occasionally includes an Engli word- gently,   gently...vigorous)   He tries to keep up  with it, and tries again to push the right button to slow down, but the machine steps starts going swiftly backward instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agency group wait for Bob. They stand up as he approa from the elevator, trying to mask a slight limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (everything's fine) Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Kawasaki notices his limp with concern as they leave the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte gets out at shibuya station, a crowded neighbor filled with neon, ads, and people. She looks up at the huge intersection as tons of JAPANESE PEOPLE wait to cross the street, no one steps forward unt the cross-walk light changes, and all of them cross. A TV screen covering a building plays commercials. She roams around the narrow streets, crowded with stylish JAPANESE KIDS, tan SCHOOLGIRLS pass her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte wanders down a crowded street, looking around. On a small side street she stops at a little park. She wa a JAPANESE MAN AND WOMAN together:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. The man reaches his hand to the back of the woman's  neck, and leans in close. The woman smiles at him, in lov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is sound asleep. Charlotte is awake next to him. She looks at the clock - it's three a.m. She slides close to him, kisses his mouth. He grumbles  something in his deep sleep, and rolls over. She goes to the couch, stepping over camera equipment. She looks at the fruit basket, decides to try an apple. S has a piece but isn't really hungry. She reaches over some proof sheets and looks at a magazin but she's already looked at it a few times before. She de to go downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sits alone at the bar. Charlotte sits down a seat awa from him, lost in his thoughts, he doesn't see her until turns and finds her next to him. They look at each other. young BARTENDER with a sweet face tends to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (line from commercial) For relaxing times, make itВ— BOB & BARTENDER 'Suntory time'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte smiles at him sympathetically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife needs space, I don't know my  kids ' birthdays.  Everyone wants  Tiger Woods, but they could get me,  so I'm here doing a whiskey  commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts a cigarette, he lights it for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just have a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes small talk about the pickled seaweed breakfast a jet lag, they commiserate about having not slept in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband's here for work-he's a  photographer- and I just came  along...I'm not really doing anything  right now, and we have some friends  who live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably just having a mid- life crisis. Did you buy a Porche?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 years... that's a long time...  Are you still in love with your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I don't know, I don't know  her anymore. I don't know if you can  be in love with one person the whole  time. I was... actually I was in  love with her sister first, when I  was twenty-one. And one day her sister  said to me she wanted to move to  Paris, so I said okay, and she said  no, she wanted to move to Paris with  Francois,   and she's still married  to him. And I moved in with Lydia...  but I always really liked Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused with too much  info) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, yet... I graduated  last spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you study?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philosophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what do you do with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I can think about  it, a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a while to figure it out.  I'm sure you will, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'm sure your mid-life crisis  will work out,too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could sleep BOB Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel is filled with business people. A dressed up FA is going to lunch. We follow a jet-lagged Charlotte and J as they walk down the lobby hall. An energetic blonde actress, KELLY, pops up to them. (She carrying a copy of Memoirs of a Geisha.) John, who was holding Charlotte's hand, drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just here shooting this band,  what about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promoting that action movie I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does a karate chop and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...doing like twenty million  interviews a day... It's soo good to  see you. How long are you here for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here for the week. I'm shooting  in Osaka for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing  there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you met Charlotte? My wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Hi! So great to meet you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, John, you're my favorite  photographer, I only want to be shot  by you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte looks at John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh..thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she fans out her  top) Sorry if I have the worst B.O., I've  been sweating in this little room  with T.V. lights for hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, giggling and acting all too comfortable with herse is eating up all the oxygen around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a big smile) ...Well, I have the worst  headache,  I have to go find some aspirin. But,  call me, let's have a drink, I'm  under Evelyn Waugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly giggles. Charlotte smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kelly and her make-up artist and publicist are off. J and Charlotte continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn Waugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn Waugh was a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon, she's nice.  Not everyone  went to Yale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its just a pseudonym, it doesn't  matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to defend her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not, but do you have to point  out how stupid everyone is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I thought it was funny. Forget  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His producer comes up to them. John puts his arm around  Charlotte, kisses her, everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) We should get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her on the cheek, and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks into the empty hotel room. C.U. - Charlot feet as she clips her toenails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. -Charlotte's hand by an ashtray, writes in a journal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte looks in a mirror, trying on an unfinished scar she's knitting.  She checks the length on herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte sits on the big window sill checking her messag on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice mail recording) Hi, leave a message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the # key as Charlotte hits it to interrupt the  message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have eighteen new messages. Press -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Charlotte, I don't know if you're  in town... but I'm having a birthday  party for my dog, Louise, tomorrow  night, at my house around eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes a number to delete the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fabulous time in Japan!  How exciting,  and hope you and your adorable husband  are enjoying it...I was sitting next  to Cathryn Myles last night at this  dinner and she was telling me about  her daughter who had this awful  boyfriend and a messy break-up and  how hard it is,and now she's single  and wants to start a family, I'm so  glad that you're settled, and not in  that situation.  Anyway, call me  when you have a chance, I'm trying  to put Thanksgiving plans together,  whether we want to go skiing or.  Daddy wants to stay home and have it  here, which might be easier with  Lauren and the children, but let me  know what your feelings are, I do  hope you and John can make it. Call  me, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte pushes a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte hangs up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies on the bed, in the knit scarf and underwea She's doing a quiz in a magazine:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Olympic pool is framed by tall glass walls with the To view. Bob is handed a swim cap and goggles. Bob watches a Japanese BUSINESSMAN swimming, he looks lik an over-grown baby. Bob swims laps in the pristine pool. He continues his laps. Under water he sees the jumping le of MIDDLE-AGED WOMEN. A disco mixed tape starts, and above water we see a WESTE INSTRUCTOR in tight shorts leading an aqua-aerobics class the group of WOMEN, They jump up and down to Sister Sledg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks past the rows of lockers to the Sauna room. He sits in the sauna, two HOTEL GUESTS speak German in th corner. Bob comes out from the sauna, red and sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob submerges in the cold water of a small pool in the sa room, having a moment of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies on the floor with big headphones on, liste to a book on tape. After a corny music intro, a very seri scholar man's voice speaks clearly : DR. KENGARD (0.S.) Did you ever wonder what your purpose life is? This book is about finding your soul's purpose o destiny. Every soul has its path, but sometimes that path not clear.  The acorn theory is an example of each soul  beginning with an imprint.... Charlotte tries to get into it, but can't get past feelin like a loser listening to a self-help tape. She looks at doctor's photo on the audio-book box, he's bald, in a  turtleneck and glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte follows a JAPANESE FAMILY in formal dress out o the elevator onto the mezzanine level. She wanders down a big hall. She sees an open door and steps in the crowded room, whic is in the midst of a press conference. Cameras flash as K with wide eyes, behind a table, answers questions  enthusiastically. KELLY You know, barbecuing, and yoga, and I love taking m dogs, Buster and Lulu, for walks on the beach... and it w great learning karate for "Midnight Racer" - I did all my own stunts! The JAPANESE JOURNALISTS seem excited by her answer. Kelly throws a Karate punch for a PHOTOGRAPHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it like working with Keanu  Reeves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was great. I've known him for a  while now- you know we both live in  L.A. We both have dogs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte continues down a hall, she stops at an open doo and peeks in. A quiet group of JAPANESE WOMEN are gathered around a tab Charlotte goes in, as she gets closer she sees they are b instructed in Ikebana floral design. Each woman has a lit vase and elegant flower cuttings. She watches as they  delicately arrange the tiny flowers. The INSTRUCTOR hands Charlotte a vase and cuttings. Along the women, Charlotte tries to follow along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte reclines low in the bathtub staring off. She ca see mount Fuji in the distance. The audio tape plays on the stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry & monotonous) Plato's text calls this image the  "paradeigma".  So the lot is the  image that is your inheritance, your  place on earth, all compacted into a  pattern that has been selected by  your soul before you even got here- or better said, that is always and  continually being selected by your  soul,because time does not enter the  equation of myth.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her back to us, Charlotte looks out the big window. John comes up and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs her for a moment, leaning on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go meet Kelly for a drink  downstairs. She wants to talk about  some photo thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Maybe I'll walk down with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't really want  her to) Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a corner table Charlotte sits with John, Kelly, and DJ CLEAN, a skinny kid in a sweatshirt, on tour in Japan. Charlotte is bored while Kelly talks on. Sausalito performs in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My Dad was anorexic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she's never heard of that) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shoots Charlotte a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very serious) He was on the American side at the  Bay of Pigs, in Cuba, and he was  taken prisoner, and they tortured  them about their food the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad fought on the American side  at the Bay of Pigs. So, when he was  a prisoner, they would tell them  they had put poison in their food  and they would make themselves throw  up... and when he got back, he did  better, but he still has food issues.  He has to have really clean food.   And really simple. He can't just go  have, say, Chinese food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying) Oh, that's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte ashes her cigarette in a clean ashtray, and she watches as it is quickly replaced with a new one by a WAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding at the view) How crazy is this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ Clean starts doing a human beat box at her. Charlotte looks over at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Oh my god you have to try it,  this power cleanse is amazing- it's  lemon juice and grade B maple syrup  and cayenne pepper for seven days.  Just like a half a teaspoon of  cayenne. The first few days you're a  little scattered, but by day four -  it's amazing... my eyes were so  white...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte excuses herself. She passes Bob who sits at his usual spot at the bar, as is leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi again, how's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do I have to fuck to get off  this planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte laughs with sympathy, but doesn't know what to  tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sleeps soundly (turned away from her), Charlotte can sleep. She turns on the T.V. to a crazy local T.V. variet show.

dialogues.speaker: INT BOB'S HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Bob can't sleep, he watches the same show on T,V. He flips the channel- it's an old black & white Japan movie of a man committing Hari Kari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte finds her way down a narrow street in an old se of Tokyo. She turns a corner and finds a square with what she was  looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines over a beautiful old temple. Birds chirp,  Charlotte approaches and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte stands in the back and watches a ceremony. A ROSHI speaks in Japanese, monks chant. It's all very  foreign.  Charlotte tries to feel something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte sits on the bed talking to John who's coming ou of the bathroom, getting ready to go to work. He checks  himself in the mirror, CHARLOTTE Am I shallow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what are you talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to a temple today and I didn't  feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks for his mobile phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ok, you'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes close and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans back to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like popcorn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some hair stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her, kissing her good-bye, she wraps her him, wh his cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right down...I'm just  leaving...ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a call. We see her back and hair, as she looks the bright window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte?! How's Tokyo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool... but,I don't know... I  went to a shrine today and all these  little monk's were chanting... and,  I didn't feel anything... I even  tried ikebana, ...   and John's using  hair products... I don't know who  IВ—.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren's Call-waiting beeps, cutting off her sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait, can you hold on one sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that, what were you  saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background a baby starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's nothing... I better go,  I'll talk to you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, have fun there, you're so lucky  you don't have any kids yet and you  can go off to Japan... call me when  you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up. She sits there for a moment, starting to cr she wipes the tears, trying to make them go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tokyo goes by out the window. Charlotte looks at the PEOP on the crowded train. A sweaty BUSINESSMAN blots his face with a little handkerchief.  Another older BUSINESSMAN re an erotic comic book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte looks up at the many signs, trying to figure ou which way to go, but they are all in Japanese characters. Confused, she chooses the west exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks down a little street in a quiet neighborh She stops at a window of a portrait studio and looks at a of the wedding portraits. They are very formal and retouc Japanese brides and grooms dressed in a Western old-fashi style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte looks through the window as a tan Japanese boy, tries to win a stuffed animal for his girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a crowded arcade, Charlotte watches some kids play Dan Revolution, a video game where you dance along to cues on the light-up floor. One BUSINESSMAN in a suit is really good into it. She sees a sushi chef game where you have to cut an elect fish. She looks at a firefighter game, and rows of plexi boxes  filled with some little character dolls you try to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte looks at the shelves of books she passes, she f through some books. She walks over to a small gallery space and goes up to th wall to see the small photos. They are of tied-up, partially naked Japanese school girl one girl is spanking another one with a stuffed animal. S making a face of ecstacy. Charlotte looks at it, not getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte stands alone on a side street, smoking a cigare and watching the CROWDS go by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks up a little street filled with shops. She stops at a window of cute underwear that she.looks at She goes into the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51C.U. Charlotte's lips. She puts watermelon color lipsti on.She looks at herself in the mirror in her new underwea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the shower running in the bathroom. Charlotte decorates the room, putting up some paper cherr blossom decorations. She goes over to the bed and stubs her toe on it, as she  flops down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds her toe, annoyed with her klutziness. John talks to her from the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the fitting, they had all these  rock n roll clothes, the label guys  kept saying lock n loll, though, but  the band doesn't look tough at  all...they look better just skinny  and nerdy, like how when they came  in...they looked so uncomfortable in  these Keith Richards clothes, they  should just be like they are, don't  you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's drifted off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think you're probably right...  because when you try to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out and is rushing to get his stuff together to g Charlotte's lounging on the bed in her new pink underwear She tries her scarf on that she's been knitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to get all his stuff together. He passes an ashtray with cigarette butts in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please stop smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I like to... and I don't smoke  that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its bad for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, I will... later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a camera from a table in the corner. He looks the self-help audio book box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Soul's Search: Finding Your True  Character and calling? Is this yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... that's nothing, someone gave  it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. It's just corny, but I'm  not into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok if you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses the side of her face and her shoulder like a cu pet, and then continues getting his stuff together. John sets two bottles of Cristal on the bed next to her, really seeing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the record company sent these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, I love Cristal, let's have some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go... and I don't really  like champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he unplugs his cell phone from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you want to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her - like don't make it harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know you have to work the  whole time, I'll probably have more  fun here. I'll call Charlie and those  guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, definitely call them, I'll be  back Friday. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tackles her, kisses her, bites her, grabs her ribs,  tickling her in a burst of affection. She laughs, her arm around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just be a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and is off. Charlotte sits there alone with the unopened bottles of  champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water splashes as Charlotte dives into the pool (in a one piece bathing suit) as the sun goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving in her robe, Charlotte runs into Bob, in his robe going to the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward, but glad to  run into her) Hi. Did you have a nice swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Did you get some sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, how about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. How long are you here  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here for the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good. Do you want to go to a  party tonight with me and some friends  who live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bob opens his door to his room, a FedEx package falls his path. He opens it - large carpet swatches fall out with a note

dialogues.speaker: BURGUNDY, BUT WHATEVER YOU WANT. LOVE, L"
dialogues.text: He looks at them for a second, they all look the same, an why is she sending these? He puts them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elaborate chiming doorbell rings. Charlotte opens the door to see Bob. He's wearing an oran camouflage T-shirt. She looks at his shirt, suppressing a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really are having a mid-life  crisis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I know, it's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the bathroom to change it. He comes out with on inside out so it's just an orange T-shirt. He asks her to cut the label out for him. She goes to fin some scissors. He picks up A Soul's Search: Finding Your  True Calling audio-book box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Soul's Search: Finding Your True  Calling - are you reading this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She returns with the hotel room sewing kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, busted, but doesn't say anything as she cuts shirt label with little hotel sewing-kit scissors. She slips on her shoes on to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All white nightclub, lit with black lights so it seems to glow in the dark, with the booming sound of helicopters.  JAPANESE GALLAGER BROTHERS walk by. Bob watches Charlotte as Charlie, in a crazy outfit, hugs her.  Charlotte tries to talk to Bob over the loud music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, this is Bob. Bob В— Charlie  Brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His real name's Hayashi, but someone  started calling him Charlie because  they thought he looked like Charlie  Brown. They've all got American  nicknames because its easier for me  to remember... they were just out in  L.A. last month doing a shoot with  John... that guy's Mr.Valentine,  he's the art director of their  magazine, I don't even know his real  name, or why I call him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks over at some SKINNY GUY in huge glasses smiling them. Charlie hands them some drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Bambi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young SHY GUY with a shaved head smiles at her, and tak her picture. A JAPANESE KRAFTWERK COVER-BAND plays Trans Europa Expres Some people at the bar buy drinks for Bob and insist on  drinking with him. Bob and Charlotte look over as Charlie gets into some pro with the BARTENDER.  The Bartender gets mad and starts  shooting a real-looking BB gun at him. Orange bullets fly through the air. They all rush out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte try to get past the crowd at the entran A big BOUNCER stops them and is yelling fast Japanese at  him. The crowd parts as the Bartender emerges shooting his BB  gun, and Bob and Charlotte run for it.

dialogues.speaker: BB GUN CHASE -
dialogues.text: The Bartender climbs on a car, threatening them from abov Bob covers Charlotte as they duck behind the car. They make a run for it, ducking into a pachinko parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte run past the blinking machines, and  gamblers, to another door to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob spots a cab and they run to it, seeing Charlie now  throwing bottles in the direction of the bartender. Bob and Charlotte get in the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte hits her head as they get in. Bob yells to the  driver to go, but he doesn't understand. Through the windshield they see the Bartender and sidekic coming with baseball bats. They hear a bang on the door and Charlie hops in. He make sure she is ok and shouts something to the Driver, and th speed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, in his flashy outfit, sings "God Save the Queen" into the Karaoke mic. He rolls his r's just like Johnny  Rotten. Charlotte laughs and loves watching Charlie. They're othe friends wear the different color wigs they provide at thi place. There are big bottles of beer and sake.  They are pretty formal. Bambi tries to talk to Charlotte with a bi grin, he can barely speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's california?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... I like your swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, you guys should come back  sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries wigs on her. He puts a light pink wig on her and beams. Bob smokes and watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawaii. (Kawaii means "cute")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles a lovable smile at Bambi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Charlotte sings "Brass in Pocket" by The  Pretenders ("you're special, so special..."), everyone is drunk now, as they all sing along at the chorus. WOMEN ke refilling the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Valentine sings a popular slow heartfelt Japanese son that everyone knows and sings along to. Charlotte and Bob look at each other, it is very foreign, but Bob likes bei there with Charlotte and her friends. She flips through a big binder of songs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you feel like singing, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sings "I fall to Pieces" to Charlotte. Charlie and  everyone cheers for him. Beer pitchers are replaced. Charlie starts singing "Angle The little room is fxlled with smoke, Charlotte makes her way to the door to get some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking a break from the crowded and hot Karaoke room,  Charlotte sits for a break alone on a bench in the bright hallway. It is quiet with just the muffled sound of music from the Karaoke room. She's wearing a pink geisha wig. B sits down next to her. Charlotte lights his cigarette with some crazy Japanese l up lighter. She leans her head back - it's getting too heavy. She looks at his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bite your nails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could cut the ones that are left  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOBU, a cool skinny stoner guy in a Hawaiian shirt, plays phsycadellic records in his seventies hippie surfer-pad. His JAPANESE  GIRLFRIEND, who looks like a 60's pin-up, pours cold sake. Bob is  handed a ridiculously big bong. Charlie is drunk and taking polaroids. Nobu, really stoned, talks to Bob about surfing. A SHORT GUY with thick glasses introduces himself to  Charlotte, extending his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Hans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans?  Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie takes pictures of Charlotte and HIROMIX, a sexy  Japanese girl, posing on a sheepskin run. They are being  hammy for Charlie who loves it. Bob walks up and is amused watching her, she sees him and gets embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: DECADENT TOKYO PARTY
dialogues.text: Hiromix dances В— Charlotte dances with Hans - she looks but beautiful... Bob dances with his eyes closed, really  into it, in the midst of all of them... the song "I Feel Young" plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte are leaving Nobu's. She's wearing Bob's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure she gets home okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob takes Charlotte's arm carefully just as she bangs her head walking into the glass door - it makes a loud thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Bob looks back at Charlie who is watching- she' fine. He leads her into a waiting cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV from cab - Tokyo neon blurs by. It looks beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte looks at the neon going by. She looks over at B her eyelids are too heavy for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I don't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob carries a very drunk Charlotte to her room. Her purse dangling from his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts her on her bed. He takes her shoes off for her an pulls a blanket over her. He looks at her lying on the bed. She opens her eyes to smile at him. He wants to kiss her, but he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down the empty hall, not wanting to leave her. As he goes he looks at various trays of leftover room ser in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob comes back to his room, tripping over the carpet samp He makes a phone call from bed. He's still a little drunk and thinking about his night out in Tokyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia, I went to this great house  tonight, this guy designed and built,  you would have loved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? I wish I had seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was this fashion guy, and there  were all these Japanese fashion people- it's a whole other world, and I was  talking to these Japanese surfers...   He was playing all this great music-  I have to find out what it was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds great В— can you hold  on... (talks to daughter) What Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you have to have something for  breakfast. Do you want cereal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to get her to eat  something...I'm glad you're having  fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, its really different here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's good, I have to get the  kids off for school.  Can I call you  in a little while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's four in the morning... I'm going  to go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, well... I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too, good-night, or good- morning .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte can-'t get out of bed. She looks at the clock-  it's 10 a.m.  She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob (still in camouflage T-shirt from last night) answers the phone by his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbly) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for getting me back in one  piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. Charlotte's feet on her bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to have some breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. her hand wraps the phone cord around her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm going to take a shower and  I'll meet you downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, see you downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in the bright light. She squints and drinks a Bl Mary. Bob is distant. She looks across at two middle-aged MID-WESTERN WOMEN tal about plastic surgery, you can't hear them, but can tell they gesture and one pulls her eye lids up. Charlotte looks at another table by the elaborate buffet sees the redhead Singer having breakfast with the rest of Sausalito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to make it  light) Hey look, it's Sausalito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see them every morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know what to say. Somehow it's too intimate ha breakfast. She eats her breakfast aware of her every move C.U. - her POV of soft scrambled eggs.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: In the distance, Bob swings on a perfect golf course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies in bed awake. The clock says its 4 a.m. Finally she gives up on trying to sleep, and turns the li on. In John's old T-shirt and Ugg boots, she goes to the  couch, looks at some strange pastry with an elaborate  presentation left by the hotel. She picks up a magazine, but she's already looked at it a few times before. She hears something and goes over to th door. On her way, she passes her red T. Anthony suitcase  overflowing with stuff that looks like a bomb went off in it. A HOTEL MESSAGE envelope is slipped under the door. She o it to see a typed note from the operator: "From: Mr. Harris. Message: Are you awake?" She smiles like she's gotten a valentine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob opens the door, Charlotte's standing there trying to  look casual, she's happy to see him (she's put some pants and flip flops instead of her dumb looking Ugg boots). She knocks into a low table, bumping her knee as she come in. Bob pours some cold sake, smoothly. Bob and Charlotte watch La Dolce Vita with Japanese subti on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans was very attentive to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he kind of liked me...Is  that so hard to imagine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, its easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd a Japanese guy get a name like  Hans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita Ekberg holds the kitten on T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte gets up to pour more sake. She picks up and looks at a prescription bottle on his ni stand and reads the label : Lipitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when we met at the  bar? ...You were wearing a tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the first time I saw you was in  the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you don't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I scowl at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you smiled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I kind of blend in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN the view of Tokyo at night as we hear their conversat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they switch the r's and l's  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. My fax said "have a  good fright".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's never come here again, because  it would never be as much fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Hiromix last night dancing  with Bambi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well... they were dancing on  the couch with that weird English  guy who kept talking about hanging  out with the Sex Pistols on Kings  Road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a fax today from your friend  Hiromix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for her show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, for a candlelight dinner, yes,  for her show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're possessive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte and Bob lie a few feet apart on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stuck. Does it get easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, yes, it does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? But look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. It does, the more you know  who you are... you don't care about  things the same way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't know what I'm supposed  to be. I thought maybe I wanted to  be a writer... but I hate what I  write, and I tried taking pictures,  but John's so good at that, and mine  are so mediocre... and every girl  goes through a photography phase,  like horses, you know dumb pictures  of your feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll figure it out. I'm not worried  about you. Keep writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I'm mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And marriage, does that get easier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard. We started going to a  marriage counselor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did that help? Did you learn anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We established that we have no  communication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to have fun, she used to  like to go to places with me for my  movies and we would laugh at all the  weirdos, but now she's tired of it  all. She never wants to leave the  kids, she doesn't need me, and they  don't need me, I feel like I'm in  the way. It gets complicated when  you have kids... that changes  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they're born its like Vietnam.  It's terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting tired) No one ever tells you that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, it's great being with them,  after they can talk, and can do things  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. My parents were always  traveling, they weren't around so  much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you grow up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In D.C., my dad was the Ambassador  to France in the eighties, so we  went to school in Paris for a few  years... but we mostly lived in D.C.,  and they were never around... and  then I moved to Los Angeles when  John and I got married... it's so  different there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are starting to get tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John thinks I'm so snotty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but that's what you like  about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over at him. He does like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to be with your  opposite, why cant similar people be  together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that would be too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall asleep dressed, on top of the sheets, on opposi sides of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full of life, Bob plays basketball with some local guys. All over the court, and towering over the other players, dominates the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at himself in the bathroom mirror, he feels his stubble and sees that it's turning grey. He opens the hotel shaving kit. He squirts shaving cream  from the child-size can. Even the razor is small. He cove his face with shaving cream when the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris, we have fax for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want I send it to your room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and shaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gets out of the elevator- the Suntory group is waitin for him. He ducks behind a wall and sneaks out a side ent of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob comes out of the hotel into the sunlight. The street crowded with MOTORCYCLE GANGS going by, one waves a big f Bob watches the strange scene in the street for a moment, and then makes his way past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down a little street in a more old-fashioned  neighborhood. He's wearing new techno sneakers. He makes call on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Kawasaki? It's Bob Harris...  I'm not going to be able to do that  interview today.., yeah... ok....  Yes, I'd love to stay to be on his  talk show... sure.. ok... bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light rain starts as he looks at a fax from Charlotte w a map she's drawn and tries to figure out where he is - t are no street signs.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. ICHICAN SUSHI
dialogues.text: Bob finally finds the small restaurant. The automatic doo opens for him, and Charlotte, at the bar with the cute ch SUSHI CHEF, turns to Bob happy to see him. He is dishevel from the rain and adorable. He sits down next to Charlotte, she pours him a beer and  orders for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They really have to work on that  street name thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perky recording voice says "Kornichiwa!" from his pocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a pink Hello Kitty watch from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she'll love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sushi Chef gives him perfect little pieces of sushi o banana leaf. Charlotte takes a bite of a piece - but it won't break, s she has to stuff the whole thing in her mouth, embarrasse Bob makes fun of her gracelessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have lunch, he makes her laugh. He looks down at her feet in flip flops, her toe is purpl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your toe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I think maybe I broke  it? I knocked into something the  other day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips her shoe off and shows it to him- her middle to is black and blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enjoys the sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get you to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, look at that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob tries to get a taxi, finally one stops and they get i He tries to explain "hospital", he does pantomime, draws first aid cross, but the DRIVER doesn't understand. Charl is enjoying Bob's effort. Finally he finds a Park Hyatt matchbook and calls the hot number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you say "hospital" in Japanese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She transfers call, it rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concierge desk, may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, can you tell me how to say  "hospital" in Japanese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hospital" in Japanese? Hosupitari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hosupitari?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tells the Driver who looks at him funny. Bob says it a faster, with a Japanese accent. The driver nods excitedly and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte walk in, looking around at where to go. Bob talks to a woman at the desk to explain what they nee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob takes a seat in waiting area as Charlotte goes into a little room with a number on it. Bob waits next to a 100 year old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte stands alone barefoot on a little box, wearing lead apron, as a MAN and ASSISTANT X-ray different angles her foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks around at all the Japanese gift stuff, and buys little stuffed bunny. His phone rings as he's paying for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we got you on an earlier flight,  but I really think you should think  about staying for that talk show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte's foot X-rays are displayed on a big light box. older DOCTOR talks about them in Japanese to his younger  ASSISTANT as he wraps Charlotte's toes together. She does know what they're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte comes out where Bob waits with the little stuff bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte arrive back at the massive hotel, they  stroll in casually, she is carrying the stuffed rabbit in her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob reclines in the big Japanese wooden tub, steam rises he is turning red. His phone rings. He dries his hands qu to reach it before it stops ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a bad time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S.) It's really hard to reach  you... Did you get the carpet samples?  I like the burgundy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, whatever you think... I'm lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I want to be more  healthy. I want to eat better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, eat healthier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all that pasta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Japanese food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Why don't you just stay there, and  you can have it everyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, Adam's tormenting Zoe,  I'll talk to you later. Are you going  to be Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll be fine. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob rides in the back of a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice-mail message) Hi Bob, it's Charlotte... how are  you doing today?... I'm going to  meet Charlie and those guys at this  place called Orange around ten...  come meet us if you get this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's cab pulls up at an empty office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at a fax from Charlotte with a map, wondering i he's in the right place. It's quiet and looks like a gene office building. He goes in the little metal elevator, and the door opens the 8th floor onto a little nightclub you would have neve thought was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights strobe and Peaches' seedy "Fuck the Pain Away" boo through the speakers. Tan JAPANESE STRIPPERS with platinum hair dance and hang  from a pole on a little platform. Bob sits alone on a brown ultra suede couch feeling out o place and empty. He looks over at a table of young AMERICAN INVESTMENT BRO He wishes he wasn't there, but tries to seem comfortable. Charlotte shows up with Charlie and the other guys. She s down next to him, and gives him an 'are you going to kill me?' look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her like it's been forever. She smiles for  forgiveness. They look over and see a WEIRD GUY in the corner getting lap dance, they look at each other, sharing the joke of t place, but both uncomfortable about the sexuality of it. Through a beaded curtain, Charlie and Bambi get lap dance in a dark corner of pillows. Charlotte looks at Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte go up to a cab, but the driver refuses  them. They don't know why, but just make their way down a empty side street. Little plastic cherry blossom decorati hang above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like she's said it a  million times) Working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sorta) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where we are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a coin in a vending machine and takes a cold sak "one-cup". A tiny brad Pitt head smiles at her next to an iced coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it weird there are no street  names in Tokyo... you'd think a city  like this would have street names...  you need a map to get anywhere...  look, there are no signs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep walking, small figures on a little empty street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they make their way back, they pass a lounge off the l It's late, it's pretty empty,  a housekeeper vacuums and  just a SLEEPING MAN sits in the back of the lounge, and a snuggled up romantic JAPANESE COUPLE sit close to: Kelly, the blonde actress, singing to them. She stands facing them with a karaoke mic singing "Nobody Does It Better" with all her heart. Bob and Charlotte look at each other and keep walking (tr to be invisible).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte lies in bed. She picks up a photo next to the b as she dials the phone.- The picture is of her and John on their honeymoon. The ph answers - it's a weird Japanese recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um..Hi, John, if this is your phone?  I'm not sure...I'm going to go to  Kyoto for the day...I'11 try you  when I get back. Hope it's going  good... I love you, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte watches the Japanese countryside go by out her  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks through a beautiful garden. She's a small figure in the landscape. She approaches a temple where she stops to watch a weddin procession. A young bride and groom in traditional kimono walk under a parasol with their family. Charlotte looks as- the nervous, young bride clutches her mother's hand. The young groom walks along with them. Charlotte is moved by the whole scene, the beauty of the  temple and the wedding party. Her eyes well up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
