dialogues.text: She walks up a narrow path, surrounded by red maple leave At the top of a little hill, she comes up to a shrine. At its entrance she sees a tree covered in little white p of paper tied to its branches. She sees Japanese people  writing on the paper and tying them to the tree. Charlott writes her wish on a paper and ties it to a branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exciting music plays as the talk/game show starts. Bob, in an elegant suit, goes out to meet the HOST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) We hear you're quite a golfer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRANSLATOR translates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) I enjoy the sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Translator translates - four sentences longer and wit added enthusiasm. After a few questions the Host excitedly announces someth to the AUDIENCE in Japanese. They scream, the lights flas Bob has no idea what's going on. A cloud of smoke reveals the IRON CHEF, with feathered ha wearing an 18th century waistcoat.  A large red chef hat placed on Bob's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They now have the competition for  you with the Iron Chef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks around as a counter is pulled up to him and now Bob and the Iron Chef are at dueling counters. The Host b instructions in Japanese, an apron with a stuffed animal  lobster on it is tied around Bob, the crowd cheers - ther no way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob rides in the back of the presidential, looking out th window at the city. He pulls a polaroid out of his pocket and looks at it. It Charlotte, peering over her shoulder with a little smile, from their sake-drenched night at Nobu's compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melodramatic '70s Japanese music plays. Bob sits alone, h himself, at the bar. The redheaded Jazz Singer takes a br and a seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the harsh-morning light, Bob wakes up in his bed. He hears the Jazz Singer singing in the shower "Midnight the Oasis". Her red mane of hair passes frame as she ushers in room  service. She seems to have taken over the whole room. He  wants it all to go away. She walks off to the bathroom an there's a knock at the door. Bob rushes to get it before can. He opens the door a crack, Charlotte looking sweet, is  standing there. Her hair is back in a pony-tail. Bob's ju wearing a towel around his waist, and his hair is stickin up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in the mood, he looks at her like he already hat himself, doesn't need more help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Daikanyama, do you want  to come walk around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but no, I can't right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The singer starts singing again in the background. Charlotte gives Bob a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I guess you're busy, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Charlotte walk away down the beige hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob is walking down the crowded street looking for Charlo when his cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bob, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't hear) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Lydia, your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't hear you. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Fine. Is it going ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to- (garbled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk to  Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls in background) Zoe, come say hello to your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little girl's voice shouts "No!" in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess she's busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you coming home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her ballet recital is Saturday, don't  forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background the daughter calls for her Mommy over a over and a dog starts barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, well, travel safely. See you  soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte, with sunglasses on, leans against the wall as approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't get sushi anywhere in Japan  after 2 o'clock. Did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we'll find something around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte are seated at a big booth in a corny Sh Shabu restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jazz singer? The red-head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at her like- don't make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess she's more around your  age...  You guys could talk about  things in common, like growing up in  the fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a brat, wasn't there anyone  else around to lavish you with  attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scowls at him. The waitress brings them drinks- she pours beer slowly, a turns on a pot on the table to cook their food. Charlotte looks at the menu - it is filled with photos of different trays of meat. The waitress doesn't speak Engli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have trouble ordering, but point to a picture on the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have two of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes some small talk, she is bugged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He orders the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where'd you go today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "This is the End" by The Doors starts playing on the ster The waitress brings two huge trays of sliced raw beef. St rises from the pot on the table. The song ends, and another Doors song comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not going to play the whole  album, are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look across the table, over the steam and meat, at e other- the whole thing is awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, under covers, Charlotte is woken up by a loud fire alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire alarm booms as the hotel guests and staff hurry of the hotel. Amidst the crowd of Hotel guests in their pajamas, Charlo finds Bob- he's wearing a kimono and slippers. She's in b shorts and an undershirt and slippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lunch was the worst, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs. She looks down at his feet stuffed into the little hotel  slippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) I'm going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean it more now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Charlotte, still in their pajamas, sit at their usual spot at the bar, with the bartender, drinking cold sake. lights two cigarettes and passes one to him. A NEW JAZZ BAND is now playing. The SINGER is full of  enthusiasm as they start their stint at the Park Hyatt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Evening. I'm Carl West, and  we're thrilled to be joining you  this week, here at the NY bar in  Shinjuku.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sings "Where or When" with all his heart. Now, old-timers there, Bob and Charlotte look at each oth and chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jt seems we stood and talked like   this before,   we looked at  each  other in  the same way thenr   but   I cant remember where or when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte sit there together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But, it doesn't last, you  have to go back sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't it last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, it just doesn't, reality  changes things....we can't stay here  forever, unless maybe we started a  Jazz band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alt Charlotte dialog: I don't know it just doesn't, real changes things...and we can't stay here forever) He looks over at her. The singer continues Where or When, as they sit there  together, the view sparkling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethings  that happen for the first  time,   seem to be happening again  and so it  seems we have met before,    and laughed before,   and loved  before,   but who knows where or  when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Charlotte, drunk in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, she pushes 54 for him and 56 for herself. They look at each other across the empty elevator, both  leaning against the walls. The elevator stops at 54, he leans in to kiss her good-ni They kiss like you would on the cheek- but it's closer to their mouths. The door shuts- he missed his floor. The elevator continues up, and stops on her floor. They k good-night again and she gets out before the door closes. He watches the door close on her as she makes her way dow the long beige hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fax comes through the machine in the empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sexy EXECUTIVE WOMAN asks Bob for a light. He looks at great legs as he lights her cigarette. He looks around,  keeping an eye out for Charlotte. The group of commercial people arrive to see him off. He excuses himself for a moment and goes to a phone on a  little table in the corner. Bob picks up the house phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, can I have room 5601.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traditional Japanese music plays on hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will connect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gets the room voice-mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Hi, Charlotte... it's me, Bob...  ok, I guess you're not there... wanted  to say good-bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, feeling lame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob with his bags tries to call again. The commercial peo and hotel staff crowd around to help him, asking about hi stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just leaving.... do you have my  jacket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah... I'll bring it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E Ok, see you in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A member of the hotel staff brings him an envelope on a l silver tray. Miss Kawasaki gives him some gifts from their company in  traditional Japanese wrapping, he doesn't know what to do with them and has to carry them. The Executive Woman from the bar walks up to him. He hang up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0hr hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him like, we could have had some fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Charlotte come out of the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, thanks, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes over to Charlotte. She looks at his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just saying good-bye to everyone  before you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits for him to say something more. He wants to tell her he loves her, that she should come with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concierge tells him his car is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... have a good flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) Ok, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away. A hotel manager asks Bob about his luggage, another asks he had a pleasant stay. Charlotte gets in the elevator to out, the doors close on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bright outside the main entrance. A presidential pul up and the automatic door opens. Bob squints as the Bellb in white gloves slowly loads his luggage into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backseat, Bob leans back on the little doily. The car pulls away. Around the corner, he looks down a crowded alley and sees Charlotte's blonde hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you pull over a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER, wearing white cloth gloves, pulls the car ove slowly. Bob tries to open the door'99 it won't open, he h to wait for the automatic doors to open for him (slowly).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gets out and rushes down the street to where he saw  Charlotte. The street is crowded with JAPANESE PEOPLE, an different colored umbrellas, (it's sunny out with a light rain). Music blasts from speakers on the street, and there is so promo going on with GIRLS handing out little cologne samp Bob looks around for her, but only sees dark hair, umbrel and super tan JAPANESE KIDS. In the distance an umbrella moves to reveal Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she can't hear him over the loudspeaker. He rushes to her. C.U. she turns and we see she is crying. The music swells. He embraces her, holding her close to h in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere) I'll miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, hugs her good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm going to miss you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte watches Bob as he reaches his car, he turns and looks at her. She smiles at him, and is lost in the crowd. Bob gets into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte walks with the crowd as they go on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the Presidential, alone, Bob leans against the li doily.  They drive off. He looks out the window, Bob's happy he's going home, he' happy he came to Tokyo. Bob's P.O.V.-  Tokyo goes past his window.
